text: A newborn baby swaddled in a blanket, held by her parents Push in... and ZOOM IN TO HER HEAD.
Out of the blackness steps a glowing figure. This is JOY. room is black except for a bright CONSCIOUSNESS SCREEN.

The baby gurgles and wiggles happily.
And there she was...
Hello, Riley.
Oh look at you. Aren’t you a little bundle of joy? A GOLDEN GLOWING SPHERE rolls from behind the screen. It’ MEMORY of what we just saw: Mom and Dad cooing at Riley.
Whoa.  INSIDE OUT 2. Joy rolls the memory on its track, illuminating the room. turns back to the button and pushes it again.
Baby Riley gurgles happily.
It was amazing. Just Riley and me, forever...
Baby Riley CRIES.
...for 33 seconds. Joy looks to her side. There’s a new, droopy, blue charac touching the button.
I’m Sadness.
Oh, hello. I’m Joy. Joy tries to muscle past Sadness to press the button.
Can I just... if you could... I just want to fix that. Thanks. The two struggle.
And that was just the beginning. Headquarters only got more crowded from there.
Riley, now age 3, barrels through the house pulling a wag
ON THE SCREEN: Riley’s POV as she runs through the house. Fear “supervises” Joy, who drives.  INSIDE OUT 3.

Riley stops. She cautiously steps over the power cord.
Easy... we’re good! We’re good.

Whew! /Nice job.

And we're back!
Riley continues her sprint through the house. Suddenly she’s picked up.

Here we go. Alright, open.

Do you think it’s safe?/What is it? ON THE SCREEN: a spoonful of broccoli. DISGUST enters.

That is not brightly colored or shaped like a dinosaur... Hold on guys... It’s broccoli! Disgust GAGS and pulls a lever.
Yucky! Riley swats the broccoli. It flies into Dad’s face.

Well, I just saved our lives. Yeah. You're welcome.  INSIDE OUT 5.
Riley, if you don’t eat your dinner, you're not going to get any dessert.
ANGER looks up from reading his newspaper.
Wait. Did he just say we couldn’t have dessert?
That’s Anger. He cares very deeply about things being fair.

So that’s how you want to play it, old man? No dessert? Oh, sure, we'll eat our dinner, right after YOU eat this! GrrrraaaAAHH!!!! Anger takes the controls as FLAMES blast out of his head. anger memory (red) rolls in.
Riley throws a fit. Dad distracts her.
('flying’ the spoon) Hey, Riley, Riley, here comes an airplane!
Anger stops screaming.
Oh, airplane. We got an airplane, everybody.
Ohh! /Ahh!
Dad “lands” the food into Riley’s smiling mouth.  INSIDE OUT 6.
A happy memory (golden) rolls in. The others leave Joy alone at the console with Sadness.
And you've met Sadness. She... well, she... FLASH CUTS of Riley crying: broken toy, spilled ice cream tantrum in the supermarket, wanting out of her car seat.
I’m not actually sure what she does. And I’ve checked, there’s no place for her to go, so she’s good, we're good. It’s all great! Sadness exits. Joy turns to the wall of golden memories.

Anyway! These are Riley’s memories-- and they’re mostly happy, you’1ll notice, not to brag. She inspects one of the golden memories: Riley and her fr MEG (both age 3) going down a slide. She REWINDS it, relishing the happy moment.
But the REALLY important ones are over here. I don’t want to get too technical, but these are called CORE MEMORIES. Joy pops up the CORE MEMORY HOLDER. Inside are five inten bright golden memories.
Each one came from a super- important time in Riley’s life. Like when she first scored a goal? That was so amazing!
Two-and-a-half-year-old Riley shoots a hockey puck across ice. She trips and accidentally scores a goal.  INSIDE OUT 7.
(cheering) Heeey! Would you look at that?! We got a future center here!

A super-bright CORE MEMORY rolls in. It rolls to the Core Memory Holder. Clicking into positio a LIGHTLINE shoots out. The Emotions follow it to the bac window and watch a new ISLAND OF PERSONALITY form.

And each core memory powers a different aspect of Riley’s personality. Like Hockey Island! Five ISLANDS OF PERSONALITY float in space, miles from Headquarters, connected by LIGHTLINES -- their power sour
Goofball Island is my personal favorite.
Toddler Riley runs naked from the bathroom, underpants on head, laughing wildly. Dad chases her with a towel.
Come back here, you little monkey!
Goofball Island activates: lights, movement, etc.
Naked Riley does the goofy dance on the sofa.
Yup, Goofball is the best! Friendship Island is pretty good too. Joy looks at FRIENDSHIP ISLAND.  INSIDE OUT 8.
Riley and Meg walk leg over leg, arms linked, laughing.
Joy inspects Honesty Island.
Oh, I love Honesty Island! And that's the truth!
A guilty Riley stands by a broken plate. She reveals a HAMMER from behind her back.
Joy examines Family Island.
And, of course, Family Island is amazing.
The family decorate cookies together. Riley stuffs one in Dad's mouth.
The Emotions look out over the Islands of Personality.
The point is, the Islands of Personality are what make Riley... Riley!
Riley splashes in the bathtub.
Look out, mermaid!
Riley climbs the couch. She looks at the floor.
Joy projects an IMAGINATION of LAVA onto the screen.
Lava! Riley jumps from couch to chair to avoid the lava.
Riley draws. Pull back to reveal she’s drawing on the wal
(singing) Who’s your friend who likes to play? Bing Bong, Bing Bong...
Six-year-old Riley skates across the ice backwards.
Hey! Very nice! Where did you learn that?
Joy skates around the room, in sync with Riley.
Riley and Meg slurp frozen drinks. Riley grimaces: ice headache!
Brain freeze! The Emotions scream as Headquarters freezes over.  INSIDE OUT 10. EXT. MINNESOTA LAKE — DAY A kids’ hockey game. Riley takes a shot and scores!
Yaaay! INT. RILEY’S MINNESOTA BEDROOM - NIGHT Parents tuck Riley into bed and turn off the light.
Good night, kiddo!
G’night, Dad. She looks up at the stars on her ceiling and falls asleep
Joy watches the screen go DARK. She inspects the shelves mostly populated with GOLDEN MEMORIES.
And... we’re out. That’s what I’m talking about: another perfect day! Nice job everybody! Let’s get those memories down to Long Term. Joy pulls a lever. Memories cascade down the shelves.

All right, we did not die today! I call that an unqualified success. The memories pachinko down the shelves and up a tube. Joy runs to the back window to watch them glide through the distant tubes towards Long-Term Memory like falling stars
And that’s it! We love our girl. She's got great friends and a great house. Things couldn’t be better. After all, Riley’s 11 now. What could happen?
Moving sign: Sold!
Wha...?
SLAM! A packed car hatchback closes.
Huh?
VROOM! A moving van drives away.
OK, not what I had in mind.
A SERIES OF SHOTS: the family car drives across America. car passes corn fields and rolling hills.
Riley sleeps in the back seat. The car zips around a mountain curve, down a desert highway. Riley looks out the back window.
The car emerges from a tunnel onto the GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE
The car drives across the bridge. Riley looks out the win
Hey look! The Golden Gate Bridge! Isn’t that great?! It’s not made out of solid gold like we thought, which is kind of a disappointment, but still! The car drives past the Ferry Building.
I sure am glad you told me earthquakes are a myth, Joy. Otherwise I’d be terrified right now! Everyone eyes each other behind Fear’s back.
Uh... yeah.
The car is stuck in traffic. Cars HONK and people YELL.
These are my kind of people!
All right, just a few more blocks. We’re almost to our new house!
Step on it, Daddy! 12.
Why don't we just live in this smelly car? We've already been in it forever.

Which, actually, was really lucky, because that gave us plenty of time to think about what our new house is going to look like! Let’s review the top five daydreams. Joy plugs in DAYDREAMS showing fantasy houses: tree water-slide house, etc.
Ooh! That looks safe!
Ohh, this is will be great for Riley! Oh, no, no, no, THIS one. A gingerbread house.
Ugh, Joy. For the last time, she cannot live in a cookie. A castle.
THAT’S the one! It comes with a dragon!
Now we're getting close, I can feel it. Here it is, here’s our new house... and... The car stops and Riley steps out. house, REVEAL: a run-down Victorian. Nothing like the daydreams.
Everyone looks slackjawed.
Maybe it’s nice on the inside. 13.  INSIDE OUT 14.
Riley steps inside. The room is dark, dusty, uninviting.
We're supposed to live here?
Do we have to?
I’m telling you, it smells like something died in here.
A disgust memory rolls in.
Can you die from moving?
Guys, you’re overreacting. Nobody is dying--
ON THE SCREEN: A dead mouse in the corner. DISGUST (0.S.) (CONT’D) I’m gonna be sick...
Great, this is just great.
Abhhhh!! It’s the house of the dead! What are we gonna do?! We’re gonna get rabies!!! Fear jumps into Anger’s arms. Anger fires up the flames.
Fear runs around on fire. Joy puts him out with a fire extinguisher.
Hey, hey, hey, all through the drive Dad talked about how cool our new room is. Let’s go check it out!  INSIDE OUT 15.
You're right, Joy/Yeah!/That’s right!/Yes, yes, yes!
Riley dashes up the stairs. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS It’s tiny. Depressing.
No, no, no, no, no./I’m starting to envy the dead mouse./Get out the rubber ball, we're in solitary confinement.
Oh, Riley can’t live here.
She's right. Really bad.
It’s the worst. It’s This house stinks. absolutely the worst. Memories roll in: anger, disgust, fear.
Hey, it’s nothing our butterfly curtains couldn’t fix. I read somewhere that an empty room is an opportunity.
Where did you read that?
It doesn’t matter. I read it and it’s great. We’ll put the bed there. And the desk over there... Joy projects an IMAGINATION of Riley’s furniture.
The hockey lamp goes there...  INSIDE OUT 16.
Put the chair there. Well, the trophy collection goes there.
Posters... Stars! I like that.
Now we're talking! Let’s go get our stuff from the moving van!
Riley dashes down the stairs as Mom and Dad enter the hou Dad is on the phone.
Alright. Goodbye. (hangs up; to Mom) Well, guess what? The moving van won’t be here until Thursday.
You're kidding.
The van is lost?! This is the worst day ever! ON THE SCREEN: Mom and Dad ARGUE.
You said it would be here I know that’s what I said. yesterday! That’s what they told me!
Mom and Dad are stressed out!
They’re arguing!/What are we going to do?/This is so stressful. /What is their problem? Joy runs to storage and grabs what looks to be a LIGHTBUL
I’ve got a great idea! She clicks the IDEA into the console.
Riley's face lights up. Riley grabs her hockey stick. Put wad of paper in play.
Did you even read the Honey, you act like this is contract? my fault--
Andersen makes her move. She's closing in!
(grabbing a broom) Hey! Oh, no you’re not!
She's lining up for the shot!
Coming behind you! Watch out! She slides past him. Knocks the “puck” into the fireplace
She shoots and she scores! Yeah!
The Emotions cheer. Out the back window, Family Island ru
(taunting Mom) Come on, Grandma!
Ha! “Grandma?”
Uh-oh, she put her hair up, we’re in for it! 17.
They all play hockey, Mom using a pillow to guard the “go Dad picks her up to shoot past her.
(laughing) Woo! Hey, put me down! Dad scoops up Riley, too. Riley giggles.
A happy memory rolls in. Joy’s back in charge.
Dad’s cell phone beeps.
Ugh. Sorry, hold on, hold on. (answers ) Hello?
Wait. Wha--?
You're kidding. All right. Stall for me, I'll be right there. (hangs up) The investor’s supposed to show up on Thursday, not today! I gotta go.
Joy is disappointed.
It's okay. We get it. 18.  INSIDE OUT 19.
You're the best. Thanks, Hon. (to Riley, as he leaves) See you, Sweetie.
Dad just left us.
Oh, he doesn’t love us anymore. That’s sad. I should drive, right? JOY BLOCKS HER.
Joy? What are you doing?
Uh, just uh, gimme one second... You know what I’ve realized? Riley hasn’t had lunch! (takes a memory off the wall and plays it) Remember? MEMORY: A PIZZA SHOP.
Hey I saw a pizza place down the street. Maybe we could try that?
Pizza sounds delicious!
Yeah!/Pizza!/Good idea, Joy. Joy smiles.
Riley and Mom get their pizza. On it: broccoli.  INSIDE OUT 20.
What the HECK IS THAT?!/Who puts broccoli on pizza?/That’s it. I’m done.
Congratulations, San Francisco, you've ruined pizza! First the Hawaiians, and now YOU!
Mom and Riley walk home. Riley looks disappointed.
What kind of a pizza place only serves one kind of pizza? Must be a San Francisco thing, huh?
Joy glances at the wall of multi-colored memories. She si things are not going well.
Still, it’s not as bad as the soup at that diner in Nebraska.
Oh yeah. The spoon stood up in the soup by itself! That was disgusting.
Joy looks out the back window. Family Island is going.
Oh good. Family is running.
The drive out was pretty fun, huh? What was your favorite part?  INSIDE OUT 21.
Spitting out the car window!
Definitely not when Dad was singing.
Wearing a seat belt!
What about the time with the dinosaur! Joy pulls up a memory.
Yeah./Yup./That’s the one. ON THE SCREEN: Riley and Mom pose in front of a roadside cement dinosaur in Vernal, Utah.
Say cheese! Behind Dad, the car rolls down the hill. No brakes!
Dad! Dad! Look behind you.
Honey. The car! The car!
Hold still. Huh? (runs off after the car) Stoooop! No no no nononono!! Stegosaurus tail through the back window. The family laug Enjoying the memory, Joy and the others chuckle.
Nice one, Joy.
(smiling) I liked that time at the dinosaur. That was pretty funny.  INSIDE OUT 22.
Joy's cheer is cut short when the dinosaur memory TURNS B

Wait. What? What happened? Joy looks back. Sadness is touching the memory.
She did something to the memory. Joy tries to fix the memory.
What did you do?
I just touched it.
That shouldn’t make it change.
Change it back, Joy! Joy rubs it, but the memory stays blue.
I’m trying.
You can’t change it back?
No, I guess I can’t!
Good going Sadness. Now when Riley thinks of that moment with Dad, she’s gonna feel sad. Bravo.
I’m sorry Joy... I don’t really know-- I thought maybe, if you-- if I-- if... I mean...
Joy, we've got a stairway coming up.
Riley runs towards a stairway and handrail.
Just don’t touch any other memories until we figure out what’s going on.
Okay.
(stepping up to controls) Alright. Get ready, this is a monster railing, and we are riding it all the way down!
Riley sits on the railing, ready to slide.
Joy looks back: GOOFBALL ISLAND is whirring like crazy.
Riley goes to slide... but hops off and walks down instea

A core memory!
Oh no! 23.
Out the back window, GOOFBALL ISLAND GOES DARK. Joy rushe the Core Memory Holder.

It looked like one was crooked so I opened it and then it fell out! Joy pops the memory back in. GOOFBALL ISLAND comes back o

You are not having a breakdown. It's stress. 24.
I keep making mistakes like that. I’m awful...

».+-and annoying.
Well... uh... You know what? You can’t focus on what’s going wrong. There’s always a way to turn things around, to find the fun!
Yeah. Find the fun. I don’t know how to do that. Long pause.
Okay. Well, try think of something funny!
Oh! Remember the funny movie where the dog dies?

Yeah, that’s not... (tries another approach) What about that time with Meg, when Riley laughed so hard milk came out of her nose? I mean come on... INSERT: Riley spitting milk out of her nose, Meg laughing
Yeah, that hurt. It felt like fire.
Okay, okay, don’t think of that. Let’s try something else. What are your favorite things to do?
My favorite? Um, well, I like it when we're outside.
That's good! Like there’s the beach and sunshine... Oh! (MORE)
Like that time we buried Dad in the sand up to his neck? INSERT: Riley at beach, Dad buried in sand.
I was thinking more like rain. INSERT: Riley stands in a downpour.
Rain? Rain... is my favorite too! We can stomp around in puddles... INSERT: Riley happily jumps through puddles.
There’s cool umbrellas, lightning storms...
More like when the rain runs down our back and makes our shoes soggy. And we get all cold and shivery... INSERT: Riley’s shoes fill with water. She looks miserabl

Oh, hey, hey... easy. Why are you crying? That’s really the opposite of what we're going for here.
Crying helps me slow down and obsess over the weight of life's problems.
Ugh, you know what? Let’s think about something else. How about we read some mind manuals, huh? Sounds fun! She drags Sadness over to a shelf of technical manuals.
I’ve read most of them. 26.  INSIDE OUT 27.
Well have you read this one? This seems interesting: “Long-Term Memory Retrieval, Volume 47?”
No.
Ohhh! A real page turner!
(opens manual; reads) “Long-Term Memory Data Selection via channel sub-grouping?”

See? Fun already! You lucky dog, you're reading these cool things and I gotta go work. Life is so unfair. Joy walks away. But just as she thinks things are handled DING! Another memory -- Disgust -- slides in. Joy groans.
Riley hops down the stairs towards the living room.
(on phone) What can we do? We’ve only got capital to last a month, maybe two. If we can't find investors by then, we're going to have to lay people off. Riley hears the stress in Dad’s voice.
Mom! Dad! Come kiss me g’night!
Be right there!
(on phone) I know, I know! We’ve got to land this, okay? Riley heads back upstairs.  INSIDE OUT 28. INT. RILEY’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER Riley climbs into her sleeping bag.
Did you hear Dad? He sounded really upset. INT. RILEY’S ROOM STRANGE NOISES from outside. Headlights cast shadows on t wall. Riley looks scared.
What was that? Was it a bear? It’s a bear!
There are no bears in San Francisco!
I saw a really hairy guy. He looked like a bear.
Oh, I’m so jumpy, my nerves are shot!
Ew, I don’t want to hear about your nerves!
I‘1l tell you what it is. This move has been a bust.
That's what I’ve been telling you guys! There are at least 37 things for Riley to be scared of right now!
The smell alone is enough to make her gag.
I can’t believe Mom and Dad moved us here!
Look, I get it. You guys have concerns. But we’ve been through worse! Tell you what: let’s make a list of all the things Riley should be HAPPY about!
Fine. Let’s see... this house stinks, our room stinks...
Pizza is weird here...
Our friends are back home...
And all of our stuff is in the missing van!
Oh c’mon, it could be worse...
Yeah, Joy. We could be lying on the dirty floor. In a bag. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley is lying on the dirty floor in a sleeping bag.
Okay, I admit it, we had a rough start. But think of all the good things that--
No, Joy. There’s absolutely no reason for Riley to be happy right now. Let us handle this.
I say we skip school tomorrow and lock ourselves in the bedroom.
We have no clean clothes. I mean, no one should see us.
Yeah, we could cry until we can’t breathe.
We should lock the door and scream that curse word we know. It’s a good one!
Now hold on! Look, we all have our off days. You know, I-- ON THE SCREEN: Mom opens Riley’s bedroom door.
Hi honey.
The Mom Bad News Train is pulling in! Toot toot! INT. RILEY’S ROOM Mom sits next to Riley.
Still no moving van. Now they’re saying it won't be here ‘til Tuesday, can you believe it?
Toot toot toot! INT. RILEY’S ROOM
Where’s Dad?
On the phone. This new venture is keeping him pretty busy. Your dad's a little stressed -- you know, about getting his new company up and running...  INSIDE OUT 31.
I rest my case! Joy sighs. She falls back from the controls. Anger steps to the console. ANGER (CONT’D) Now for a few well-placed withering scowls. INT. RILEY’S ROOM
I guess all I really want to say is: thank you.
Huh? Anger drops the controls. INT. RILEY’S ROOM
You know, through all this confusion you've stayed... well, you've stayed our happy girl! Mom brushes Riley’s cheek.
Your dad’s under a lot of pressure. But if you and I can keep smiling, it would be a big help. We can do that for him, right?
Joy, smiling with renewed purpose, steps back to the cons
Whoa! Well.  INSIDE OUT 32. INT. RILEY’S ROOM
(smiles) Yeah! Sure.
What did we do to deserve you? (kisses Riley) Sweet dreams.
Good night.
Well, you can’t argue with Mom. “Happy” it is.
Team Happy! Sounds great! I'm totally behind you, Joy. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley goes to sleep.
The screen goes black.
Looks like we’re going into REM. I got Dream Duty, so I’ll take care of sending these to Long Term. Great day today, guys! Sleep well
The team heads off to bed. Harp music plays.
Alright, what's on tonight, Dream Production? ON THE SCREEN: a DREAM COMES UP. The family FLIES happily through the air in the car. They land in front of the house--  INSIDE OUT 33.
Well, this is it. The new place. -- except it’s haunted! Organ music. Ghosts howling. The mouse rises up into frame.
Come live with me, Riley! The mouse falls over, dead. A bear enters, holding a pizz

Eat me! I’m organic! INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley frowns in her sleep.

Ah, NO, who is in charge of programming down there?! I know I’m not supposed to do this, but... Joy ducks behind the console and REBOOTS it. The dream en INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley still looks troubled.

We are not going to end the day like this. Joy has a thought. She recalls a memory. ON THE SCREEN: Riley ice skates with her parents. Joy watches, loving this kid. She shadows Riley, “skating around headquarters.  INSIDE OUT 34.

Don’t you worry. I’m gonna make sure that tomorrow is another great day. I promise. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley SMILES in her sleep. INT. KITCHEN —- MORNING Riley excitedly snarfs down breakfast cereal.
Joy plays the accordion around Headquarters. The others appear, looking grumpy. Joy yells over the noise.
Hello! Did I wake you?
DO you have to play that?
Well, I have to practice. And I don't think of it as playing so much as hugging. She tosses aside the accordion and runs off.

Okay, first day of school! Very, very exciting! I was up late last night figuring out a new plan. Here it is. (to Fear) Fear! I need a list of all the possible negative outcomes on the first day at a new school.
Way ahead of you there. Does anyone know how to spell “meteor?”
Disgust! Make sure Riley stands out today... but also blends in.
TOOT TooT! 35.
When I’m through, Riley will look so good the other kids will look at their own outfits and barf.

(addressing herself) Joy! Yes Joy? You'll be in charge of the console, keeping Riley happy all day long. And may I add I love your dress, it’s adorable. Oh, This ol’ thing? Thank you so much, I love the way it twirls... A TRAIN rushes by outside.
Train of Thought! Right on schedule. The engineer waves from the cab and drops off a large bag
Anger! Unload the daydreams. I ordered extra in case things get slow in class.
Might come in handy, if this new school is full of boring useless classes, which it probably will be... Sadness walks by. Joy stops her.
Oh - Sadness! I have a super important job just for you.
Really?
Mmm-hmmm. Follow me.
Joy draws a chalk circle on the floor around Sadness’s feet.
What are you doing?
(finishing the circle) And... there. Perfect. This is the circle of Sadness. Your job is to make sure that all the Sadness stays inside of it.
So... you want me to just stand here?
Hey, it’s not MY place to tell you how to do your job. Just make sure-- (nudging Sadness’ foot back over the line) --ALL the Sadness stays in the circle. Sadness stands there.
See? You're a pro at this! Isn’t this fun?!
No.

(heading to the console) Atta girl. Alright everyone, fresh start! We are gonna to have a good day, which will turn into a good week, which will turn into a good year, which turns into a good LIFE! INT. SAN FRANCISCO HOUSE —- MORNING Mom helps Riley on with her backpack. Dad is on the phone
So, the big day! New school, new friends, huh?
I know! I’m kinda nervous, but I’m mostly excited! How do I look? Do you like my shirt?
Joy looks back at Family Island, working away.
Very cute! You gonna be okay? You want us to walk with you?
Mom and Dad? With us in public? No thank you.
(operating console) I’m on it.
Nope, I’m fine. Bye Mom! Bye Dad!
(covering phone) Have a good day at school, Monkey! All three make monkey sounds at each other.
Goofball Island works out the back window.
Riley giggles as she exits.
Have a great day, sweetheart.
Riley walks up to her new school. New kids everywhere. hesitates.
Are you sure we want to do this?
In we go! 37. She  INSIDE OUT 38.
Okayyy! Going in! Yes. Riley perks up and walks in.
Riley sits at her desk and looks at the other kids in cla
Okay, we've got a group of cool girls at 2 o'clock.
How do you know?
Double ears pierced, infinity scarf... A group of makeup-wearing girls look back at Riley.
Whoa. Is she wearing eye shadow?
Yeah, we want to be friends with them.
Let’s go talk to ‘em!
Are you kidding?? We’re not TALKING to them, we want them to like us.
Oh! (then) Wait, what?

(drops a giant stack of paper on the console) Almost finished with the potential disasters. Worst scenario is either quicksand, spontaneous combustion, or getting called on by the teacher. So as long as none of those happen...  INSIDE OUT 39.
Okay, everybody. We have a new student in class today.
Are you kidding me?! Out of the gate? This is not happening!
Riley would you like to tell us something about yourself?
Nooooooo! Pretend we can’t speak English!
Don't worry. I got this. Joy pushes a lever.
Uhh... okay. My name is Riley Andersen. I’m from Minnesota. And now I live here.
And how about Minnesota?... Can you tell us something about it? Well you certainly get a lot more snow than we do.
(laughs) She’s hilarious! She turns a lever.  INSIDE OUT 40.
Riley smiles, in spite of all the eyes on her.

Yeah, it gets pretty cold. The lake freezes over, and that’s when we play hockey. I’m on a great team. We're called the Prairie Dogs. My friend Meg plays forward. My Dad's the coach. Pretty much everyone in my family skates.
Joy recalls a MEMORY: the family skating together.
Riley “watches” the memory, smiling.
It’s a kind of family tradition. We go out on the lake almost every weekend.
Joy smiles. Then, mysteriously, the IMAGE TURNS BLUE.
Riley's smile fades, her brow furrows.
Or we did, ‘til I moved away.
Confused, Joy looks around.
Huh?/Hey, what gives?/What?
Hey-- She spots Sadness, who is guiltily touching the memory.
Sadness! You touched a memory?! We talked about this.
Oh yeah, I know. I’m sorry.
Get back in your circle. (trying to eject memory) Gnnh! What’s going on? Why won’t it eject?!! She fiddles with the console, but the blue memory won’t m
Get it out of there, Joy!
(sniffling) We used to play tag and stuff...
Cool kids whispering at 3 o'clock!
The other kids whisper and stare.
Did you see that look?!? They're judging us!
Oh no. Joy tries pulling the memory. Anger, Fear and Disgust hel
Somebody help me. Grab that... everybody... They pull with all their might, but the memory’s not budg 41.  INSIDE OUT 42.
But everything’s different now. Since we moved... TEARS stream down Riley’s face.
Oh no! We’re CRYING AT SCHOOL!!! Joy turns to the console. SADNESS IS DRIVING.
What? No! Sadness, what are you doing? Joy finally yanks the memory out. She runs to the console pulls Sadness away from the controls.
Oh no, I'm sorry... I... oh... PING! A memory is created. BRIGHT BLUE.
Huh?
Whoa!
It’s a core memory!
But it’s blue! The bright blue core memory rolls through the memory shel and STARTS TOWARDS THE CORE MEMORY HOLDER!

No wait... stop it! No! Ahh! Joy leaps to the holder and pops it open, preventing the blue core memory from going in. Joy grabs it. She pushes the end-of-day “memory flush” button. The tube comes down from the ceiling.  INSIDE OUT 43.
(trying to take her memory back from Joy) Joy, no. That’s a core memory, Joy!
Hey! Stop it. Let go. As they struggle, they bump into the Core Memory Holder, KNOCKING ALL OF THE CORE MEMORIES OUT onto the floor.
Ahh! The core memories! Out the window, the ISLANDS OF PERSONALITY GO DARK.
Riley, her face tear-stained, looks up.

Ahh! Joy tosses the blue core memory aside to collect the yell core memories. Sadness grabs the blue core memory and heads to the Core Memory Holder to plug it in. Joy lunges, knocking the blu core memory out of Sadness’s hands. It’s SUCKED UP the va tube. Joy trips backward. In the chaos a yellow core memory rol toward the tube.

No, no, no, no! She reaches to grab it and gets sucked up the tube hersel along with the other core memories -- and Sadness! Fear, Anger and Disgust now stand alone in Headquarters. stunned silence as the tube retracts.
Riley sits and wipes her tears.  INSIDE OUT 44.
Thank you, Riley. I know it can be tough moving to a new place, but we're happy to have you here. Alright everyone, get out your history books and turn to chapter seven. Riley hides behind her book.
Can I say that curse word now?
Joy and Sadness scream as they rocket down the tube. Joy desperately tries to hold on to the core memories. The blue core memory is sorted to a side tube.
Joy lands in a bin of memories. Sadness crashes next to h
Oh no... (gathering memories) One, two, three... okay, got ‘em. Wha-- where are we? Joy takes in the shelving around her.
Long-Term Memory...! Joy grabs the core memories and jumps out of the dumpster She sees GOOFBALL ISLAND, silent and dark.
Goofball Island. Joy surveys the islands beyond. They’re all dark.
Hoh... Riley’s Islands of Personality. They’re ALL down! This is bad.  INSIDE OUT 45.
We-- we can fix this. We just have to get back to Headquarters, plug the core memories in, and Riley will be back to normal. Joy and Sadness hurry towards headquarters.
Riley has no core memories, no personality islands and no-- (gasp)
Wha-- What is it?
You! YOU’RE not in headquarters. Without you, Riley can’t be happy. We gotta get you back up there.
I’m coming, Riley. They set off across the bridge to Goofball Island. We see LIGHTLINE beyond it, leading towards Headquarters.
Riley and her parents eat dinner.
So as it turns out the green trash can is not recycling, it’s for greens. Like compost. And eggshells.
(not really listening) Mmm.
And the blue one is recycling. And the black one is trash. Riley pushes food around on her plate.
Riley is acting so weird. Why is she acting so weird?
What do you expect? All the islands are down.
Joy would know what to do.
That’s it! Until she gets back, we just do what Joy would do!
Great idea! Anger, Fear, Disgust. How are WE supposed to be happy?
Hey, Riley. I’ve got good news!
I found a junior hockey league right here in San Francisco. And get this: try-outs are tomorrow after school. What luck, right?
Hockey?
Uh-oh. What do we do?
Guys, uh, this... Here, you pretend to be Joy. Fear pushes Disgust forward. She steps up to drive.
Won't it be great to be back out on the ice?  INSIDE OUT 47.
(sarcastic) Oh yeah, that sounds fantastic.
What was that? That wasn’t anything like Joy.
Uh, because I’m NOT Joy.
Yeah, no kidding.
Mom, taken aback, eyes Riley. Zoom in to Mom's head... INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S SADNESS Did you guys pick up on that?
Uh-huh.

head_text.subj: MOM'S JOY / MOM'S FEAR / MOM'S DISGUST

text: Oh yeah/Definitely. MOM’S DISGUST Something’s wrong. MOM’S ANGER Should we ask her? MOM’S SADNESS Let’s probe. But keep it subtle, so she doesn’t notice.
So! How was the first day of school?
She's probing us.
I'm done. (to Fear) YOU pretend to be Joy.
What? Uh... okay... hmm.
(nervous ) It was fine, I guess, I don't know.
Oh, very smooth, that was JUST like Joy.

MOM’S ANGER Something’s definitely going on. MOM’S DISGUST She’s never acted like this before. What should we do? MOM’S SADNESS We're going to find out what’s happening. But we’ll need support. Signal the husband.
Mom clears her throat at Dad. He doesn’t notice. Zoom in Dad’s head... INT.
All of Dad’s emotions are watching a HOCKEY MATCH, cheeri 48.  INSIDE OUT 49.
...-with a nice pass over to Reeves, he comes across center ice...
Again Mom stares, clears her throat. Dad looks up, cluele
Uh-oh. She’s looking at us. (turns off the memory) What did she say?
What? Uh, sorry, Sir. No one was listening.

Is it garbage night? We left the toilet seat up? What? What is it, woman, what?!? INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S DISGUST (re: Dad on the screen) He’s making that stupid face again. MOM’S ANGER I could strangle him right now! MOM’S SADNESS Signal him again.
Mom raises her eyebrows and tilts her head towards Riley. finally gets it.
Ahh, so, Riley! How was school? INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS Mom’s Emotions give up.  INSIDE OUT 50.

head_text.subj: MOM'S JOY / MOM'S SADNESS / MOM'S FEAR

text: You gotta be kidding me!/He really needs to start paying attention./ Is he paying attention at all?
For THIS we gave up that Brazilian helicopter pilot? INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS
Move! I’LL be Joy.
(snarky) School was great, alright?
Riley, is everything okay? Riley rolls her eyes.
Sir, she just rolled her eyes at us.
What is her deal? Alright, make a show of force. I don’t want to have to put “the Foot” down.
No. Not the Foot.
Riley, I do NOT like this new attitude. INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS
Oh I’1l show you attitude, old man.  INSIDE OUT 51.
No, no, no! Stay happy! Anger shoves him away and hits a button.
What is your problem? Just leave me alone.
Sir! Reporting high levels of sass!
Take it to DEFCON 2. Sirens begin to BLARE.
You heard that, gentleman. DEFCON 2.
Listen young lady, I don’t know where this disrespectful attitude came from... INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS
You want a piece of this, Pops? Come and get it! Anger grasps two levers with all his might.
Yeah, well... well... INT. DAD’S HEADQUARTERS
Here it comes... Prepare the Foot!  INSIDE OUT 52. Dad's Emotions uncover “Launch Station” buttons, insert k
Keys to safety position! Ready to launch on your command, Sir! INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS ANGER, flames and yell at full blast, pushes up the lever
Just SHUT UP! Dad and Mom are shocked.
That’s it, go to your room! Now! Riley pushes away from the table and goes upstairs in a h
The Foot is down! The Foot is down! They all CHEER.
Good job gentlemen. That could have been a disaster. INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S SADNESS Well, that was a disaster. Mom's Anger recalls a memory: the Brazilian helicopter pi
Come fly with me, gatinha.
They all SIGH.
Riley slams her bedroom door.
In the distance, Family Island RUMBLES. Joy and Sadness have made it across Goofball Island and m now walk across the thin lightline. Below is the darkness the Memory Dump.
We’re gonna walk out there? On that?
It’s the quickest way back.
But it’s right over the Memory Dump. If we fall we’ll be forgotten forever!
We have to do this. For Riley. Just follow my footsteps.
Hohh... ok.

(stepping onto lightline) It's not that high. It’s totally fiii... Whoa... She loses her balance. Almost drops a memory over the sid Sadness steps out onto the lightline. They inch along. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - LATER Dad knocks on Riley’s door, peeks in.
Hey. Riley’s in her sleeping bag. She doesn’t answer. 53.  INSIDE OUT 54.
So uh, things got a little out of hand downstairs. You want to talk about it? (still no answer) Come on. Where’s my happy girl? Monkey. (he tries monkey noises)
He’s trying to start up Goofball. Fear looks at the empty Core Memory Holder, then out the window: GOOFBALL ISLAND is dark and silent. INT. RILEY’S ROOM
Come on. (tries more monkey noises) Riley looks at Dad, but TURNS AWAY.
Goofball Island crumbles and breaks.
Joy sees the lightline breaking ahead.
Ahhh! Go back! RUN! RUN! RUN! They run back onto Goofball Island as the lightline crumb
Joy and Sadness frantically outrun collapsing debris.
They leap across the buckling bridge, making it over to t cliff just in time to see Goofball Island fall into the d  INSIDE OUT 55.

What-- ? Joy watches it sink. FLASH CUTS of Young Riley: * Riley twirling until she falls over. * The family jumping on a trampoline. * Riley riding on Dad’s shoulders, making silly faces wit ice cream all over her face. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS
I get it, you need some alone time. We'll talk later.
The Emotions stare out the back window in disbelief.
We have a major problem.
Ohh, Joy where are you?
Joy and Sadness stare down into the abyss.
We lost Goofball Island. That means she can lose Friendship, and Hockey, and Honesty, and Family! You can fix this, right Joy?
I... I don’t know. (Sadness sighs in despair) But we have to try. C’mon. The sky darkens.

Riley’s gone to sleep. (more sighs from Sadness) .»-which is a good thing, when you think about it, because nothing else bad can happen while she’s asleep! We'll be back to Headquarters before she wakes up. We’1ll just go across Friendship Island.  INSIDE OUT 56. Shelves jut out over the cliff edge, making Friendship Is inaccessible.
We’ll never make it, hoh... nooo...
No, no, no, don’t obsess over the weight of life’s problems, remember the funny movie where the dog dies?! Sadness face plants.
Uhhh, Sadness, we don’t have time for this. She looks to her side. Memory shelves wind into the dista Joy heads off into the maze.
We'll just have to go around! Take the scenic route.
Wait! Joy, you could get lost in there!
Think positive!
Okay. I’m positive you will get lost in there. That’s Long-Term Memory. An endless warren of corridors and shelves. I read about it in the manuals. Joy stops. Sadness is right. But wait!
The manuals? The manuals! You read the manuals!
Yeah...
So you know the way back to headquarters!
I, guess...
Joy grabs Joy heads
You are my map! Let’s go! Lead on, Mind Map! Show me where we’re going!
Okay! Only, I’m too sad to walk. Just give me a few... hours. Sadness’ leg and DRAGS her into the shelves.
Which way? Left?
Right. (Joy turns right) No. I mean, go left. I said left was right, like “correct.”
Okay.
This actually feels kind of nice. off into the COMPLICATED LABYRINTH ahead of them.
Okay! Here we go. We’ll be back to Headquarters before morning. We can do it. This’ll be easy. This is working!
Joy, exhausted, drags Sadness through the maze of shelves
This is not working. Are we getting close?
Yeah. Just another right. And a left. Then another left, and a right...
Are you sure you know where we’re going? Because we seem to be walking AWAY from Headquarters-- 57.  INSIDE OUT 58. The SKY BRIGHTENS. Day. And they’re still lost.
Riley’s awake. Joy drops a core memory. Sadness reaches to grab it.
Ah ah ah, don’t touch, remember? If you touch them, they stay sad!
Oh. Sorry. I won't... Joy looks behind her. The bottom row of memories are BLUE
...starting now.
I can’t take much more of this.
Forget ‘em!
Mind Workers! Joy runs off toward the voice.
But Joy we’re almost... ohhhh.
Joy finds two workers vacuuming up memories from the shel
Phone numbers. We don’t need all of these. They’re in her phone.
Just forget all of that. Please. Forget it!
Excuse me. Hi. I need to find Friendship Island...
(pointing to memories) Look at this. Four years of piano lessons.
Yeah, looks pretty faded.
You know what? Save "Chopsticks” and “Heart and Soul,” get rid of the rest. Zoop! The memories get vacuumed up.
Are you--
U.S. Presidents. What do you think?
Eh, just keep Washington, Lincoln and the fat one.
Forget ‘em!
Hey! You can’t throw those away! Those are perfectly good memories.
The names of every “Cutie Pie Princess” doll?
Yes! That is critical information! Glitterstorm, Honeypants, Officer Justice...
Forget ‘em! He vacuums up the memories behind Joy.
The memories shoot out a sewer pipe and fall into the darkness of the Memory Dump.
Hey! Bring those back.
They're in the dump. Nothing comes back from the dump.
Yeah. Look lady, this is our job,
When Riley doesn’t care about a memory, it fades.
Fades?
Happens to the best of ‘em.
(pulls memory from a cart) Except for this bad boy! This one will NEVER fade.
(recognizing it) The song from the gum commercial?
(conspiratorial) Sometimes we send that one up to headquarters for no reason.
It just plays in Riley’s head over and over again. Like a million times! Ha! Let’s watch it again! She rewinds it and plays it again. They sing along.
Tripledent gum will make you smile! Tripledent gum! It lasts a while! Tripledent gum will help you, mister, to punch bad breath right in the kisser.
We all know the song. Okay. Yup. Real catchy.
(to Female Forgetter) What do ya think? Should we do it?  INSIDE OUT 61.
Yeah! Ha ha!
OK, here we go! Ha ha ha! He tips the gum memory into the inner workings of the she FWOOM! It shoots up towards Headquarters.
Fear, Anger and Disgust are having a peaceful morning. Th memory drops into Headquarters, playing at full volume.
Tripledent gum will make you smile! Tripledent gum! It lasts a while--
Wha-- this again!?!
The Forgetters walk away, laughing and singing.
(following them) Wait! Do you know how to get to Friendship Island?!
Riley, laptop on her stomach, hums the Tripledent gum son
(on the computer) Do you like it there? Did you feel any earthquakes? Is the bridge cool?
Yeah, it’s good. What happened with the playoffs?
We won the first game. Coach says we might actually go to the finals this year. Oh, and we’ve got this new girl on the team. She’s so cool.  INSIDE OUT 62.
Oh, she did NOT just say that.
A NEW GIRL? Meg has a new friend already?! Anger GROWLS.
Hey hey, stay happy! We do NOT want to lose any more islands here guys! INT. RILEY’S ROOM
We can pass the puck to each other without even looking. It’s like mind reading!
You like to read minds, Meg? I got something for you to read right here! (grabbing the controls)
No no no, what are you doing?!
Wait, wait-- let’s just be calm for one second-- Anger snaps Fear’s nose like a rubber band. Anger slams t controls forward like a lunatic.
INT. RILEY’S ROOM
I heard they have parrots living in-
I gotta go.  INSIDE OUT 63.
What?
Riley slams down the computer and SCOWLS.
Joy follows the Forgetters, trying to get directions. The ignore her, singing the gum-commercial jingle. A horrible mechanical GROANING sound. Joy reacts.
What...?
Joy rounds a corner and sees Friendship Island crumbling.
Friendship Island? The FRIENDSHIP CORE MEMORY Joy holds fades. She runs forw
Wh-- ? She looks on in horror as Friendship Island falls.
Ohh, not Friendship. Joy hugs the core memories. One of them is memory of youn Riley and Meg walking together.
Oh, Riley loved that one. And now it's GONE. Goodbye friendship, hello loneliness. Joy sees Hockey Island in the distance.
(trying to stay positive) We'll just have to go the long way. They turn to look back into the deep memory shelves.
Yeah. The long, long, looong way. I’m ready. Sadness lies down on the ground, offering her leg. Joy si She doesn’t want to do this again.
Ah, yes. (pulling Sadness) There’s gotta be a better way.
(talking to the memories) Ohhh, look at you, you’re a KEEPER!
Huh? Joy sees a strange figure up ahead, gathering memories.
I will take you, but not you. (beat) Oh who am I kidding, I can’t leave you!
Hello! The figure sees Joy -- and bolts.
Wait! Hey, wait! Stop! Joy chases after him.
Joy rounds a corner to find the figure crouched on the ground, hiding his face in his hands like a three year ol
Excuse me...?
(jumping up; cornered) Ahhhh! Uh, I was looking for, uh-- (grabs a memory)
He THROWS IT and makes a run for it. 64.  INSIDE OUT 65.
Ha ha! So long, sucker! He immediately crashes into a cart of memories.
Ow! Oww, I hurt all over.
Wait. I know you.
No you don’t. I get that a lot, I look like a lot of people.
No, I do! Bing Bong! Riley’s Imaginary Friend!
You really DO know me!
Well of course! Riley loved playing with you, you two were best friends! Oh! You would know. We’re trying to get back to Headquarters...
Headquarters? You guys are from Headquarters?
(mock modesty) Well, yeah. I’m Joy. This is Sadness.
You're Joy? THE Joy?
Mm-hmm.
Well what the heck are you doing out here?
That's a good question! You want to answer that, Sadness?  INSIDE OUT 66.
Without you, Riley won’t ever be happy. We can't have that, we gotta get you back! I’11l tell you what, follow me.
Oh, thank you!
Bing Bong leads them on through the memory shelves.

It is so great to see you again. I gotta tell you, I am such a huge fan of your work. Do you remember when you and Riley were in a band? FLASH CUTS of their adventures: *Riley bangs on pots and pans, Bing Bong plays his trunk.
I went to all of your concerts.
Yeah, I blow a mean nose. *Bing Bong runs on ceiling, Riley chases after him.
Watching you play tag was such a treat.
Two-time world champ. *Riley and Bing Bong sit in her wagon ("rocket").
Oh, and remember your rocket?!
Of course! It runs on song power.
That's right, your theme song! (singing) Who's your friend who likes to play?
(sings)
His rocket makes you yell “Hooray!”
Sadness eyes Bing Bong, who is a pink elephant made with cat tail.
What exactly are you supposed to be?
You know, it’s unclear. I’m mostly cotton candy, but shape-wise, I’m part cat, part elephant, part dolphin.
Dolphin? Bing Bong does a spot-on dolphin impression.
You gotta remember, when Riley was three, animals were all the rage. The cow goes moo. The horse goes neigh. That’s all people talked about back then.
Yeah, I guess that’s true. What are you doing out here?
Well, there’s not much call for imaginary friends lately, so, uh, you know, I’m...
Hey, hey, don’t be sad. Tell you what, when I get back up to Headquarters, I’1ll make sure Riley remembers you.
You will?!  INSIDE OUT 68.
Of course, she’d love that!
Ha ha! This is the greatest day of my life! He launches into a jig, but hurts himself and bursts into tears. Candy pours out of his tear ducts.
Are you okay?
What’s going on?
I cry candy. Try the caramel, it’s delicious.
Ooo. (fumbles memories) Woah!
Oh-- here-- use this. (offers his satchel)
Thanks!
Oh, hold on. Wait a second. He empties out an impossible amount of stuff: tons of memories, a boot, an anchor, a cat... Joy and Sadness sta in amazement.
What? It’s imaginary. Joy accepts the satchel and puts in the core memories.
Thanks! This‘’ll make it a lot easier to walk back to Headquarters.
Walk? We’re not walkin’! We’re taking the Train of Thought! He points to the train speeding towards Headquarters.
The train, of course! That is so much faster! But how do we catch it?
Well, it kind of goes all over the place, but there is a station in Imaginationland. I know a short cut. Come on, this way!
I’m so glad we ran into you! A giant BUILDING blocks their progress. Bing Bong opens a door. It’s dark inside.
The station is right through here. The train station is visible through a door on the other
After you.
Joy...
What?
I read about this place in the manual. We shouldn’t go in there.
Bing Bong says it’s the quickest way to Headquarters.
No, but Joy, this is Abstract Thought.
What’re you talking about? I go in here all the time. It’s a shortcut, see? He points to a “Danger” sign above the door.
D-A-N-G-E-R: shortcut. I’1ll prove it to you. (he climbs in) (MORE )
Look at me! I’m closer to the station ‘cause I’m taking the shortcut!
Let’s go around. This way. She points: the building is huge -- it’s a long way aroun
Almost there...! Joy looks back at Bing Bong. The station is right there.
(to Sadness) If you want to walk the long way, go for it. But Riley needs to be happy. I’m not missing that train. (walks in) Bing Bong knows what he’s doing. He's part dolphin. They're very smart.
Well, I guess... She climbs in. EXT. SCHOOL LUNCH YARD —- LUNCHTIME Riley carries her lunch tray outside. The yard is full of chatty, happy kids, but Riley finds an empty bench and ea by herself.
Two Mind Workers approach the same door our trio entered.
Okay, what abstract concept are we trying to comprehend today?
(checking a clipboard) Um... loneliness.
Hm. Looks like there’s something in there. I’m going to turn it on for a minute and burn out the gunk.  INSIDE OUT 71. She closes the door.
What’d I tell ya? You’1ll be at Headquarters in no time. BAM! The door closes behind them. The LIGHTS GO ON.
Say, would you look at that! Around them, strange SHAPES float into space.
Whoa! What's happening?!
Oh no. They turned it on.
Huh! I’ve never seen this before. Bing Bong’s head turns into a Picasso-like form. Joy and Sadness scream as they become Cubist versions of themselv
My face! My beautiful face!
What is going on?
We're abstracting! There are four stages. This is the first: non- objective fragmentation!
Alright, do not panic! What is important is that we all STAY TOGETHER. His arm falls off.
Ah! Joy's head falls off. Sadness’ leg goes. She topples.
We’re in the second stage: we're deconstructing!  INSIDE OUT 72.
Run! Bing Bing falls into pieces.
Aaah! I can’t feel my legs! (his disassembled arm finds them) Oh, there they are.
Come here, me! They gather their pieces as they rush to the exit.
We've gotta get out of here before we're nothing but shape and color! We'll get stuck here forever!
“Stuck?!” Why did we come in here?!
I told you, it’s a shortcut! Though the window, the TRAIN OF THOUGHT pulls in.
The train! POP! They change into FLAT COLOR VERSIONS of themselves.
Oh no... We’re two-dimensional! That’s stage three!
We're getting nowhere!
Depth! I’m lacking depth! It’s hard to move. They struggle towards the window.
Come on! Sadness and Bing Bong follow and try to squeeze through. because of the broken perspective, they are now all HUGE compared to the door.  INSIDE OUT 73.
AUGH! We can’t fit! POP! They abstract into ABSTRACT COLORED BLOBS.
Oh no, we're nonfigurative. This is the last stage!
We're not going to make it! Sadness slumps to the ground... and becomes a line!
Wait! We’re two dimensional. Fall on your face! (crawls like an inchworm)
Ooh! They follow Sadness and inch safely out the window.
The three lines land outside just as the train pulls out. They get up to go, but as lines they can barely move.
Wait! Stop! Stop! STOP! POP! Joy goes from non-representational to two-dimensiona She falls down flat as the train speeds off. POP! The three transform back to normal.
(to Bing Bong) I thought you said that was a shortcut.
I did, but wow, we should NOT have gone in there. That was dangerous! They really should put up a sign.
How long till the next train?
Who knows? But don’t worry. There’s another station. That way! (MORE )
(points 0.S.) The train always stops there right before it goes to Headquarters. If we hurry, we can catch it!
This isn’t another one of your short cuts, is it?
(laughing exuberantly) Yeah! Joy skeptically watches him head off.
(to Sadness) Is there really another station?
Uh-huh. Through there. Bing Bong leads them towards the impressive gates of...
Welcome to Imaginationland!
Imaginationland?
Sure! I come here all the time. I’m practically the mayor. Hey, you guys hungry? There’s French Fry Forest! (starts eating) Nom nom nom, delicious! Joy is loving this.
No way!
Check it out! Trophy Town! Medals! Ribbons! Everyone’s a winner! Bing Bong kicks a soccer ball into a giant goal and worke appear out of nowhere to shower him with awards.  INSIDE OUT 75.
I won first place! Workers give Joy a medal and Sadness a ribbon.
Me too!
Hohh... Participation award...
Wait, is that-- Sadness, look, it’s Cloud Town! That is my favorite! Joy rips off a chunk of cloud and floats up into the air.
It's so soft! Joy jumps down and runs off.
Woah! Let me try! Bing Bong rips off some cloud. A CLOUD MAN emerges from t house, angry.
Hey! What's the big idea? You'd better fix that wall, or else you're in big troub-- POOF! Bing Bong blows the Cloud Man away and walks off nervously.
Joy and Bing Bong gleefully jump between couch cushions.
Oh no, lava! Whooo! Whawhoooo! Imaginationland is the best! Sadness tries to jump to a rock, barely makes it.
Is it all going to be so interactive?  INSIDE OUT 76.
Hey, look! The House of Cards!! Ooh, wait, hang on just a minute... From a nearby garage made of cards, Bing Bong pulls a wag
Your rocket!
Yeah! I stashed it in there for safekeeping. Now I’m all set to take Riley to the MOON! He gestures proudly -- accidentally knocking over the hou
Oh, I’m sorry.
Great.
I love Imaginationland!
Isn't it great? And there’s always something new, like... A giant machine. A conveyer belt reveals a handsome teena
Who the heck is that?
Imaginary Boyfriend.
I would die for Riley. Joy grimaces.
I’ve never seen him before.
I live in Canada.
Anyway. This way, through Preschool World! We’re nearly to the train!
Riley, here we come!
Mom and Riley sit on the bleachers.
This should be fun. New team, new friends! These kids look pretty good -- considering they're from San Francisco. Heh heh!
Okay Andersen, you're up!
I gotta go. Riley heads onto the ice.
Okay. Good luck, sweetie!
Luck isn’t gonna help us now. If she tries to use Hockey Island, it’s going down.
